about:
As a recent graduate with a Master's in Autonomy & Robotics from the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign (Dec'24), I am currently working as a Robotics Engineer at Prof. Sunoj Shajahan's Digital Precision Agriculture Lab, alongside Prof. John Reid at UIUC. My work involves developing and integrating key components like vision-based autonomous navigation, safety features, and an autonomous vision-based mechanical weeding system, all aimed at advancing agricultural technology. These systems are being tested and optimized on the AMIGA platform for real-world agricultural applications. 
Previously, I have worked at Rucha Yantra LLP as a Robotic R&D Intern, where I gained hands-on experience working with Autonomous Guided Vehicles (AGVs) and other vision-based automation project. My contributions spanned developing algorithms for computer vision, navigation, and control systems, as well as implementing solutions using hardware like Raspberry Pi, NVIDIA Jetson and other sensors. 
I hold a B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering from Shri Ramdeobaba College of Engineering and Management, where I was an actively involved in the Robotics and Technical Clubs. I also secured third place in the NASA Space Settlement Contest in 2014 and first place in Drone Challenges. 
I am currently open to full-time job opportunities in robotics and autonomy, and I am eager to leverage my skills and experience to contribute to innovative projects in the field. Passionate about solving real-world problems, I am excited to work alongside industry experts to create impactful solutions that push the boundaries of robotics and autonomous systems.
